title: Anti-corruption newspaper shuts down after ‘press freedom hero’ jailed
description: José Rubén Zamora's newspaper, El Periódico, exposed corruption for 27 years. It's the latest victim in a wave of government repression in Central America.

title: New Zealand hostel fire kills at least six people
description: Six people have been confirmed dead in a fire that broke out in a Wellington hostel around 12:30 a.m. on Monday, officials said.

title: What’s next after Turkey’s election, which is headed to runoff?
description: Polls ahead of Sunday’s vote showed a tight race, but Erdogan ended election day ahead. Here's what will happen next.

title: Post-9/11 wars have contributed to some 4.5 million deaths, report suggests
description: Researchers attempt to calculate the number of deaths attributable to the war on terrorism, across Afghanistan, Pakistan, Iraq, Syria, Libya, Somalia and Yemen.

title: Russia dismisses report that Wagner boss offered to reveal troop positions
description: Mercenary boss Yevgeniy Prigozhin lashed out at The Washington Post over a report on classified U.S. intelligence stating that offered to betray the Russian military if Kyiv withdrew from Bakhmut.

title: Biden officials say border crossings down 50 percent since Title 42 lifted
description: Officials from Homeland Security and other federal agencies described conditions at the southern border after the end of pandemic-era Title 42 rules for migrants

title: Strikes in Russian-held Luhansk showcase Ukraine’s longer-range missiles
description: As President Volodymyr Zelensky visited Britain on Monday, Ukraine showed its ability to use long-range British-made missiles to hit targets deep inside Russian occupied territory.

title: Two Rembrandt portraits, overlooked for nearly 200 years, are unearthed
description: The small, oval-shaped paintings were last seen in 1824, when they were privately purchased. "They're extraordinary," said the auctioneer who rediscovered them.

title: With Erdogan leading, Turkey election heads to runoff
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said he was prepared for a runoff against Kemal Kilicdaroglu, as he claimed a narrow lead in the contest.

title: Meet the Ivy-educated opposition leader who could end Thai military rule
description: Pita Limjaroenrat’s Move Forward Party came first in an early election tally, but his ability to become prime minister is not guaranteed.

title: Fans went to admire El Salvador’s gang crackdown — and got arrested
description: “We let ourselves fall for this propaganda,” one of the men said. “And the reality is totally different.”

title: Why Turkey’s elections matter so much for the world
description: On May 14, Turks head to the polls in a pivotal election that could unseat President Recep Tayyip Erdogan after 20 years in power.

title: Climate change imperils coffee. A rescue plan is brewing in Vietnam.
description: As climate change imperils the much-loved but vulnerable arabica coffee plant, Vietnam is going all in on more robust robusta.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Zelensky secures new military aid from Paris, Berlin
description: France has agreed to train and equip several Ukrainian battalions with tens of armored vehicles and light tanks.

title: In Turkey’s tight election, Erdogan prepares for possible runoff
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said he was prepared for a runoff against Kemal Kilicdaroglu, as he claimed a narrow lead in the contest.
